name: raccoon
text: RUTABAGA

text: Dammit, if only they were that easy.

text: 15 lames now, 15 people really hate asherdan

name: carlyle
text:
I think I saw two in the earlier comments without one lame on them.

I was probably hallucinating, but I like think not.

name: daaaaang
text: most asherdan comments are pretty good, but lamed into nothingness, and then followed by a bunch of comments about how they are pretty good.

name: whuppins
text:
I love how Ray doesn't even try to solve the puzzle. That 10 bucks is totally not worth his time.

Also, the spineless E is a nice touch. Hardcore, 80's style.

name: killerlimpet
text: I've always been a fan of triangle-A's myself

name: arbys
text: I assumed he tried but couldn't figure it out.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
A spineless 'E' is a silent cry for help, a symbol of deep psychological terror.

That will be $400, Ray.

name: bobothebum
text:
I sign my name with spineless "E"s.

Do I still have to pay you $400?

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Yes, and be quick about it. I see here your payment is delinquent going on a year now.

name: 1000hz
text:
Note that Ray doesn't write out "Seventy-Five" in the DOLLARS field. He puts another $75.00, just in a different handwriting.

Hilarious.

name: crinklebat
text:
-=RAY=-

Man this just nails everything about Mensa in a way that is so perfect it makes me feel a little weird.

name: qbit
text: I never figured Ray as the fountain pen type.

name: straw
text: Well, he is writing to Mensa.

name: ch
text: Dude writes lotta checks.

name: mikebox
text: The sad thing is that he remembers Ringo and forgot George Harrison :(

name: stuart
text: A comment left by stuart was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by featurelessvoid, lamboyster, radarjammer, Art-Vader, mountain, Aiglos, LRosetw8)

name: cousinted
text: Not when you think the Beatles consisted of John, Ringo, Paul, Anita and The Fat One

name: liquidcruelty
text: I think the real joke here is overlooked by people who haven't actually looked into or dealt with MENSA personally.  This strip represents pretty well their overall requirements for admission and in fact their worth as an organization.

name: doc_rostov
text:
It's SO TRUE. I know a guy. Total washout. Struggling through his 3rd year of community college. Dude has no job, lives in his parents basement, has money coming out of his ears. Had to take High School Algebra 4 times. This dude was not the president of the equation of the week club, let me tell you. Moral of this story: he's in Mensa and he's the assistant regional coordinator.

Now everyone let us watch as I screw up my italics for all eternity to see.

name: doc_rostov
text: OH HELL AND DAMN YES

name: tekende
text: YOU ARE BBCODING THE DREAMS OF THE CHILDREN WHO HAVE NO ONE TO SPEAK FOR THEM

name: presrvdkillick
text: This is you right? You told us a story about yourself?

name: doc_rostov
text:
You did not get the daily double.

Let's be honest, though. If it was about me, it would be pretty damn impressive if I was in my 3rd year of being a community college washout at age 17.

name: greenkoolayd
text: how does one have money coming out of ones ears, with no job?

name: doc_rostov
text: Inheritance.

name: rowboat
text: 'Sup, Doc?

name: doc_rostov
text: Not a hell of a lot. Started school again. Sucky schedule this semester, and a lotta stress now that I'm two years removed from graduating and getting out there into reality-world. How about you?

name: rowboat
text: Oh, just spending my time surrounding myself with amazing musicians in the hopes of being confused for an amazing musician as opposed to being seen as what I actually am, which is a solidly mediocre musician. It usually works.

name: splendorr
text: Success in school does not, in any serious way, correspond with intelligence or aptitude. I know this is hard for good-at-school people to agree with. And certainly one can be both good at school at smart. I'm saying, no direct correlation, because some incredibly smart people cannot handle that bullshit.

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by fosters, jezebel, lux, rival)

name: liquidcruelty
text: MENSA tried "darker and edgier" in the nineties, but realized along with everyone else that they're no Frank Miller

name: soticoto
text: They're [i]still[i] trying .

name: soticoto
text:
Well fuck.
I'm going to pretend this never happened.
I was never here.

... shame .

name: xiaomimi
text:
Oh my goodness! From the "Mensa Workout" on their website...

[IMGS OFF]

name: boredom_man
text: orange tits

name: tekende
text: Stronger

name: firesign
text:
Some observations:

1. The wrong answer is far more popular than the correct one. Apparently the achewood fanship is more willing to collectively wish for orange tits than to deal with the word "stronger"...

2. This comment of xiaomimi's was lamed. Now, not only does she routinely bust ass to provide us with the relevant blogs alongside each comic, with convenient hyperlinks no less, but in this case she has done outside research to show us a concrete example of the relevance and accuracy of the strip. This does not seem lame. I ask, L_C_B, did your finger slip? Did you mean to click elsewhere? If not, perhaps you could do more for the community than xiaomimi? Fie. Shame on you, sir.

name: spinynorman
text: oh man, he called the lightning, you brought the thunder

name: ford
text: apparently folks with transmetropolitan avataricons totally have each other's backs.

name: jhunter
text: is that how it works? is this a thing? summarily I shall change my own avataricon (is that the correct term? Is that slang of todays youth culture? ) to Hugh Laurie and become hell of tight with Spinynorman and we will drink wine and eat chicken and everything will be a-ok

name: choosebro
text: Back off buddy. I'm Spinynorman's icon buddy. He's mine .

name: i_love_kate
text: Am I Hedonismbot's icon buddy? Because I'm not okay with that.

name: hyetal
text: I drew my own.  I have no wine but ample chicken.  Perhaps I shall press the chickens in a chicken-press to make Chicken Wine.

name: tatterdemalion
text:
I would like to sample a glass of your finest Chicken Wine.

(never did I think I would get a chance to typ that. Thank you. Thank you so m

name: tatterdemalion
text: so...much.  My comment brilliance was shattered.  *sob*

text: I chubbied xiaomimi on your say-so even though one can no longer view the image. Just thought you might like to know. I also chubbied you for the stand-up-ness of that defense.

text: Here you go.

text: Wow to the service around here! Thank-you!

text:
People need to know how incredibly silly Mensa is

They need to know

text: oh, oh gosh.

name: liquidcruelty
text: GERSTRON, THE ACCUSER

name: peterjoel
text: Following his recent open heart surgery, doctors described Ray's condition as "stable, with all signs pointing to a full recovery".

name: artifakt
text: Oh man, Rutabaga! What is that stuff?

name: charchar
text:
It is a hella nasty tuber that your grandma will call 'soul food' and trick you into eating.

[IMGS OFF]

I know it looks harmless...
Do not be fooled.

text: I ain't remember no damn rutabagas at Soul Food Night in college

name: rowboat
text: That's because you were eating soul food in Oklahoma.

text: also college

name: rowboat
text: Educated Oklahomans got no soul. This started as joke, but in the end I can't help but believe it.

name: tim_simmons
text: so... can someone solve the thing? is it even a puzzle? i would try but uni is finished for the year so my brain has turned off.

name: slalvation
text: see the word is basically just written under the question in non-mixed up order.

name: beansdooma
text: It appears the date on the check is simply Tober 05.

name: unclejam
text: So Ray is in MENSA. Then did he really try to get smooth on some chick with a bag of raisins in her purse?

name: deovalente
text:
I can only name three Beatles and my roommates hate me for it. It was awkward when they showed me a picture of John Lennon and asked if I knew who it was, and not knowing the answer, I replied randomly with "Mark David Chapman."

The End! No Moral.

name: i_love_kate
text: You don't know who John Lennon is but you can name his killer? I find this somewhat difficult to believe, I am sorry to say.

text:

Nice Pete: Book update for October 15th.

Today's Blogs

Teodor: Ray's Mind-Menses

name: ford
text: Damn but those blogs are unusually excellent today.

name: jawsh
text:
Pfft. Who can't name all four beatles?

Let's see.

John Lennon.
Elvis.
Thomas...Jefferson.

name: tekende
text: And Dr. Phil.

name: selbencoirlo
text: Mark, Paul, John, and Leviticus. Right?

name: selbencoirlo
text: Mark, Paul, John, and Leviticus. Right?

name: foetus_punch
text: I think that one of the hidden geniuses of this strip is the fact that MENSA just randomly drops the P-bomb (the Pliny the Elder bomb, similar to the F-bomb in many ways). It's like they just want so hard to appear smart, they will name-drop things that smart people know about. Funny to me, anyway.

name: edwell
text: MENSA is to classical literature as Family Guy is to '80s TV shows.

name: charchar
text:
What made this strip for me is that the plural of 'genius' is genii . Not 'geniuses'.

Mensa, I am yur mom and I took you to school that car of pain. SAY IT!

name: charchar
text: Holy fuck, i mis-spelled 'your' while correcting Mensa's vocabulary.  People die from this much poetic justice.

name: artvandelay
text: The justice would have been more poetic if you'd actually been correct. I gave you a chubby anyway, for trying to be clever. It is important to try and be clever!

name: saru
text: For those reading this in later times, wondering what he's saying, and too lazy to go to dictionary.com yourselves, "genii" is only the plural of genius when you're speaking of a guardian spirit or similar.

name: backdraft
text:
Also, for what it's worth I believe you are taken to school in the car of pain.

Although at a guess, I'd say that's worth about nothing.

name: i_love_kate
text: Man, Charlie, this was just a hella poor effort.

name: glyphtheory
text: Ray's just the kinda guy to sign over $75 without question when the letter tells him to "brace yourself for another incredible year as yourself! " The dude loves encouragement, and honestly, I think we can all relate.

name: saulbellow
text:
The real MENSA test is how this all fits together as one document. He appears to be holding a single page, but there is a letterhead at the top of the text shown in panels 2-4.

The only solution I can see is that panel 2 is a letter, and panels 3 and 4 are either two sides of a card insert, or maybe a folding card insert, as such:

[IMGS OFF]

name: afterward
text: aw man that image is nice, good on you saulbellow.

name: derelictman
text:
I knew Ray didn't really have a one-eighty IQ.

The amusing part is that he payed to join MENSA and they told him he was a genius, and he believed this. This very belief marks him as the opposite of a genius .

name: octafish
text: Those MENSA people think they're so smart.

name: lechatbotte
text:
Pliny the Elder was a cool dude, who wrote alot of great books, some of which are quoted to death by Tacitus (early, important historian). Unfortunately, other than these quotes, his early histories are completely lost. Dude even seems to have invented the Biography, but alas and alack, we only have a few quotes of this as well.

Only one work of his remains: a very important 37 volume encyclopedia of all known knowledge from his day, the "Historia naturalis" - important because it was in Latin, not Greek, and in 77 CE (AD) it was the first time such learning was presented in Latin. In fact, Pliny goes on long-winded like about how silly the Greeks are.

Later, the dude got himself killed by Vesuvius when it brought the smack down on Pompeii and Herculeum - an event he failed to record at all!

So, the "complete works" of Pliny the Elder is all 37 volumes of "Historia naturalis", which Onstad has Mensa putting in a single volume (!) and, given the catalog of all things natural that this is, the most likely solution to the puzzle is:


RUTABAGA.


But now you know.
